entry.title: Newsletter #101
entry.content:
Hi guys, even after the 100th newsletter we still have something to suggest you.

This week Cirpo, David and Alex went to the warehouse … it seems Namshi Tech will release a new application soon.

Here the links, enjoy:

  • 365 days of cultural kaisen

  • a cfg optimizer for php

  • building successful apis overnight

  • chatops at github

  • components should be focused, independent, reusable, small and testable (first)

  • cultivating a code review culture // speaker deck

  • docker implemented in 100 lines of bash

  • es6 in depth: arrow functions ✩ mozilla hacks – the web developer blog

  • how nginx plans to support http/2

  • is react.js fast? faster than {framework}? … or are there more relevant questions to be asking? — medium

  • managing bias | facebook

  • microsoft edge vs. google chrome: which web browser is faster?

  • on unit testing by kevin cennis

  • one in every 600 websites has .git exposed

  • react contexts and dependency injection — jack hsu

  • reactfire 0.5.0 – firebase

  • seven surprising javascript ‘features’

  • the hitchhiker’s guide to modern javascript tooling

  • the real 10 algorithms that dominate our world — medium

  • the ultimate guide to forms in angular 2 « ng-book.com – blog

  • understanding design patterns in javascript – tuts code tutorial

  • way we work — medium engineering

  • what is chatops? and how do i get started?
